TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract sealed beforefieldinit WebSiteOperationsExtensions extends System.Object

Docs.summary: The Web Sites Management API provides a RESTful set of web services that interact with the Windows Azure Web Sites service to manage your web sites. The API has entities that capture the relationship between an end user and Windows Azure Web Sites service. (see http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windowsazure/dn166981.aspx for more information)

MemberSignature.Value: public static Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.WebSites.Models.WebSiteOperationStatusResponse BeginSwappingSlots (this Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.WebSites.IWebSiteOperations operations, string webSpaceName, string webSiteName, string sourceSlotName, string targetSlotName);

.method public static hidebysig class Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.WebSites.Models.WebSiteOperationStatusResponse BeginSwappingSlots(class Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.WebSites.IWebSiteOperations operations, string webSpaceName, string webSiteName, string sourceSlotName, string targetSlotName) cil managed

Docs.param: Reference to the Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.WebSites.IWebSiteOperations.
Required. The name of the web space.
Required. The name of the web site.
Required. The name of the first web site slot to swap (source).
Required. The name of the second web site slot to swap with (target).
Docs.summary: You can swap a web site from one slot to another slot.
Docs.returns: The response body contains the status of the specified long-running operation, indicating whether it has succeeded, is inprogress, has timed out, or has failed. Note that this status is distinct from the HTTP status code returned for the Get Operation Status operation itself. If the long-running operation failed, the response body includes error information regarding the failure.

MemberSignature.Value: public static Microsoft.WindowsAzure.OperationResponse CreateRepository (this Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.WebSites.IWebSiteOperations operations, string webSpaceName, string webSiteName);

.method public static hidebysig class Microsoft.WindowsAzure.OperationResponse CreateRepository(class Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.WebSites.IWebSiteOperations operations, string webSpaceName, string webSiteName) cil managed

Docs.param: Reference to the Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.WebSites.IWebSiteOperations.
Required. The name of the web space.
Required. The name of the web site.
Docs.summary: A web site repository is essentially a Git repository that you can use to manage your web site content. By using Git source control tools, you can push or pull version-controlled changes to your site. This API executes a repository create operation. (see http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windowsazure/dn166967.aspx for more information)
Docs.returns: A standard service response including an HTTP status code and request ID.

MemberSignature.Value: public static System.Threading.Tasks.Task<Microsoft.WindowsAzure.OperationResponse> CreateRepositoryAsync (this Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.WebSites.IWebSiteOperations operations, string webSpaceName, string webSiteName);

(see http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windowsazure/dn166967.aspx for more information)
Docs.returns: A standard service response including an HTTP status code and request ID.

Docs.param: Reference to the Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.WebSites.IWebSiteOperations.
Required. The name of the web space.
Required. The name of the web site.
Required. Parameters supplied to the Delete Web Site operation.
Docs.summary: You can delete a web site by issuing an HTTP DELETE request. If the web site being deleted is the only site remaining in a server farm, you can optionally delete the server farm as well by using the deleteEmptyServerFarm parameter. (see http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windowsazure/dn236430.aspx for more information)
Docs.returns: A standard service response including an HTTP status code and request ID.

MemberSignature.Value: public static Microsoft.WindowsAzure.OperationResponse GeneratePassword (this Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.WebSites.IWebSiteOperations operations, string webSpaceName, string webSiteName);

.method public static hidebysig class Microsoft.WindowsAzure.OperationResponse GeneratePassword(class Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.WebSites.IWebSiteOperations operations, string webSpaceName, string webSiteName) cil managed

Docs.param: Reference to the Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.WebSites.IWebSiteOperations.
Required. The name of the web space.
Required. The name of the web site.
Docs.summary: You can generate a new random password for publishing a site by issuing an HTTP POST request. Tip: If you want to verify that the publish password has changed, issue an HTTP GET on /publishxml before calling /newpassword. In the publish XML, note the hash value in the userPWD attribute. After calling /newpassword, call /publishxml again. You can then compare the new value of userPWD in the Publish XML with the one you noted earlier. (see http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windowsazure/dn236428.aspx for more information)
Docs.returns: A standard service response including an HTTP status code and request ID.

MemberSignature.Value: public static System.Threading.Tasks.Task<Microsoft.WindowsAzure.OperationResponse> GeneratePasswordAsync (this Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.WebSites.IWebSiteOperations operations, string webSpaceName, string webSiteName);

.method public static hidebysig class System.Threading.Tasks.Task`1<class Microsoft.WindowsAzure.OperationResponse> GeneratePasswordAsync(class Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.WebSites.IWebSiteOperations operations, string webSpaceName, string webSiteName) cil managed

Docs.param: Reference to the Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.WebSites.IWebSiteOperations.
Required. The name of the web space.
Required. The name of the web site.
Docs.summary: You can generate a new random password for publishing a site by issuing an HTTP POST request. Tip: If you want to verify that the publish password has changed, issue an HTTP GET on /publishxml before calling /newpassword. In the publish XML, note the hash value in the userPWD attribute. After calling /newpassword, call /publishxml again. You can then compare the new value of userPWD in the Publish XML with the one you noted earlier. (see http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windowsazure/dn236428.aspx for more information)
Docs.returns: A standard service response including an HTTP status code and request ID.

Docs.summary: A web site repository is essentially a Git repository that you can use to manage your web site content. (see http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windowsazure/dn166967.aspx for more information)
Docs.returns: The Get Repository Web Site operation response.

Required. The name of the web space.
Required. The name of the web site.
Docs.summary: You can retrieve current usage metrics for a site by issuing an HTTP GET request. The metrics returned include CPU Time, Data In, Data Out, Local Bytes Read, Local Bytes Written, Network Bytes Read, Network Bytes Written, WP Stop Requests, Memory Usage, CPU Time - Minute Limit, and File System Storage. (see http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windowsazure/dn166991.aspx for more information)
Docs.returns: The Get Usage Metrics Web Site operation response.

Docs.param: Reference to the Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.WebSites.IWebSiteOperations.
Required. The name of the web space.
Required. The name of the web site.
Required. The name of the first web site slot to swap (source).
Required. The name of the second web site slot to swap with (target).
Docs.summary: You can swap a web site from one slot to another slot.
Docs.returns: The response body contains the status of the specified long-running operation, indicating whether it has succeeded, is inprogress, has timed out, or has failed. Note that this status is distinct from the HTTP status code returned for the Get Operation Status operation itself. If the long-running operation failed, the response body includes error information regarding the failure.
